problem_names:
lemma minimal:
  assumes "x \<in> A" and "Q x"
  shows "\<exists>y \<in> A. P\<^sup>=\<^sup>= y x \<and> Q y \<and> (\<forall>z \<in> A. P z y \<longrightarrow> \<not> Q z)"

lemma min_elt_ex:
  assumes "B \<subseteq> A" and "B \<noteq> {}"
  shows "\<exists>x. x \<in> B \<and> (\<forall>y \<in> A. P y x \<longrightarrow> y \<notin> B)"

lemma min_elt_mem:
  assumes "B \<subseteq> A" and "B \<noteq> {}"
  shows "min_elt B \<in> B"

lemma min_elt_minimal:
  assumes *: "B \<subseteq> A" "B \<noteq> {}"
  assumes "y \<in> A" and "P y (min_elt B)"
  shows "y \<notin> B"

lemma eq_upto_lexmin_non_empty:
  assumes "C \<subseteq> SEQ A" and "C \<noteq> {}"
  shows "eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<noteq> {}"

lemma lexmin_SEQ_mem:
  assumes "C \<subseteq> SEQ A" and "C \<noteq> {}"
  shows "lexmin C \<in> SEQ A"

lemma non_empty_ith:
  assumes "C \<subseteq> SEQ A" and "C \<noteq> {}"
  shows "ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i \<subseteq> A"
  and "ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i \<noteq> {}"

lemma lexmin_minimal:
  "C \<subseteq> SEQ A \<Longrightarrow> C \<noteq> {} \<Longrightarrow> y \<in> A \<Longrightarrow> P y (lexmin C i) \<Longrightarrow> y \<notin> ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i"

lemma lexmin_mem:
  "C \<subseteq> SEQ A \<Longrightarrow> C \<noteq> {} \<Longrightarrow> lexmin C i \<in> ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i"

lemma LEX_chain_on_eq_upto_imp_ith_chain_on:
  assumes "chain_on (LEX P) (eq_upto C f i) (SEQ A)"
  shows "chain_on P (ith (eq_upto C f i) i) A"

lemma min_elt_ex:
  assumes "B \<subseteq> A" and "B \<noteq> {}"
  shows "\<exists>x. x \<in> B \<and> (\<forall>y \<in> A. P y x \<longrightarrow> y \<notin> B)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>x.
       x \<in> B \<and>
       (\<forall>y\<in>A. P y x \<longrightarrow> y \<notin> B)
using assms

proof (prove)
using this:
  B \<subseteq> A
  B \<noteq> {}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>x.
       x \<in> B \<and>
       (\<forall>y\<in>A. P y x \<longrightarrow> y \<notin> B)
using minimal [of _ "\<lambda>x. x \<in> B"]

proof (prove)
using this:
  B \<subseteq> A
  B \<noteq> {}
  \<lbrakk>?x \<in> A; ?x \<in> B\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>y\<in>A.
                       P\<^sup>=\<^sup>= y ?x \<and>
                       y \<in> B \<and>
                       (\<forall>z\<in>A.
                           P z y \<longrightarrow> z \<notin> B)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>x.
       x \<in> B \<and>
       (\<forall>y\<in>A. P y x \<longrightarrow> y \<notin> B)
by auto

lemma min_elt_mem:
  assumes "B \<subseteq> A" and "B \<noteq> {}"
  shows "min_elt B \<in> B"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. min_elt B \<in> B
using someI_ex [OF min_elt_ex [OF assms]]

proof (prove)
using this:
  (SOME x.
      x \<in> B \<and>
      (\<forall>y\<in>A. P y x \<longrightarrow> y \<notin> B))
  \<in> B \<and>
  (\<forall>y\<in>A.
      P y (SOME x.
              x \<in> B \<and>
              (\<forall>y\<in>A.
                  P y x \<longrightarrow> y \<notin> B)) \<longrightarrow>
      y \<notin> B)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. min_elt B \<in> B
by (auto simp: min_elt_def)

lemma min_elt_minimal:
  assumes *: "B \<subseteq> A" "B \<noteq> {}"
  assumes "y \<in> A" and "P y (min_elt B)"
  shows "y \<notin> B"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. y \<notin> B
using someI_ex [OF min_elt_ex [OF *]] and assms

proof (prove)
using this:
  (SOME x.
      x \<in> B \<and>
      (\<forall>y\<in>A. P y x \<longrightarrow> y \<notin> B))
  \<in> B \<and>
  (\<forall>y\<in>A.
      P y (SOME x.
              x \<in> B \<and>
              (\<forall>y\<in>A.
                  P y x \<longrightarrow> y \<notin> B)) \<longrightarrow>
      y \<notin> B)
  B \<subseteq> A
  B \<noteq> {}
  y \<in> A
  P y (min_elt B)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. y \<notin> B
by (auto simp: min_elt_def)
text \<open>A lexicographically minimal sequence w.r.t.\ a given set of sequences \<open>C\<close>\<close>

fun lexmin
where
  lexmin: "lexmin C i = min_elt (ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i)"
declare lexmin [simp del]

lemma eq_upto_lexmin_non_empty:
  assumes "C \<subseteq> SEQ A" and "C \<noteq> {}"
  shows "eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<noteq> {}"
proof (induct i)
case 0

proof (state)
this:
  

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. eq_upto C (lexmin C) 0 \<noteq> {}
 2. \<And>i.
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<noteq> {} \<Longrightarrow>
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i) \<noteq> {}
show ?case
using assms
by auto

proof (state)
this:
  eq_upto C (lexmin C) 0 \<noteq> {}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<noteq> {} \<Longrightarrow>
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i) \<noteq> {}
next

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<noteq> {} \<Longrightarrow>
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i) \<noteq> {}
let ?A = "\<lambda>i. ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i"

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<noteq> {} \<Longrightarrow>
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i) \<noteq> {}
case (Suc i)

proof (state)
this:
  eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<noteq> {}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<noteq> {} \<Longrightarrow>
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i) \<noteq> {}
then
have "?A i \<noteq> {}"
by force

proof (state)
this:
  ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i \<noteq> {}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<noteq> {} \<Longrightarrow>
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i) \<noteq> {}
moreover

proof (state)
this:
  ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i \<noteq> {}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<noteq> {} \<Longrightarrow>
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i) \<noteq> {}
have "eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<subseteq> eq_upto C (lexmin C) 0"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<subseteq> eq_upto C (lexmin C) 0
by auto

proof (state)
this:
  eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<subseteq> eq_upto C (lexmin C) 0

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<noteq> {} \<Longrightarrow>
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i) \<noteq> {}
ultimately

proof (chain)
picking this:
  ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i \<noteq> {}
  eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<subseteq> eq_upto C (lexmin C) 0
have "?A i \<subseteq> A" and "?A i \<noteq> {}"
using assms
by (auto simp: ith_def)

proof (state)
this:
  ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i \<subseteq> A
  ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i \<noteq> {}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<noteq> {} \<Longrightarrow>
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i) \<noteq> {}
from min_elt_mem [OF this, folded lexmin]

proof (chain)
picking this:
  lexmin C i \<in> ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i
obtain f where "f \<in> eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  lexmin C i \<in> ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>f.
        f \<in> eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i) \<Longrightarrow>
        thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
by (auto dest: eq_upto_Suc)

proof (state)
this:
  f \<in> eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) i \<noteq> {} \<Longrightarrow>
       eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i) \<noteq> {}
then

proof (chain)
picking this:
  f \<in> eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i)
show ?case
by blast

proof (state)
this:
  eq_upto C (lexmin C) (Suc i) \<noteq> {}

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

  shows "lexmin C \<in> SEQ A"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):

proof -

proof (state)

fix i

proof (state)

 1. lexmin C \<in> SEQ A

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. lexmin C \<in> SEQ A
have "?X \<subseteq> A"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):

using assms
by (auto simp: ith_def)

moreover

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. lexmin C \<in> SEQ A
have "?X \<noteq> {}"
using eq_upto_lexmin_non_empty [OF assms]
by auto

proof (state)
this:
  ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i \<noteq> {}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. lexmin C \<in> SEQ A
ultimately

proof (chain)
picking this:
  ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i \<subseteq> A
  ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i \<noteq> {}

using min_elt_mem [of ?X]

No subgoals!

lemma non_empty_ith:
  assumes "C \<subseteq> SEQ A" and "C \<noteq> {}"
  shows "ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i \<subseteq> A"
  and "ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i \<noteq> {}"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i \<subseteq> A &&&
    ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i \<noteq> {}
using eq_upto_lexmin_non_empty [OF assms, of i] and assms
by (auto simp: ith_def)

lemma lexmin_minimal:
  "C \<subseteq> SEQ A \<Longrightarrow> C \<noteq> {} \<Longrightarrow> y \<in> A \<Longrightarrow> P y (lexmin C i) \<Longrightarrow> y \<notin> ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>C \<subseteq> SEQ A; C \<noteq> {}; y \<in> A;
     P y (lexmin C i)\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> y \<notin> ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i
using min_elt_minimal [OF non_empty_ith, folded lexmin]

lemma lexmin_mem:
  "C \<subseteq> SEQ A \<Longrightarrow> C \<noteq> {} \<Longrightarrow> lexmin C i \<in> ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>C \<subseteq> SEQ A; C \<noteq> {}\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> lexmin C i \<in> ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i
using min_elt_mem [OF non_empty_ith, folded lexmin]

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<lbrakk>?C1 \<subseteq> SEQ A; ?C1 \<noteq> {}; ?C1 \<subseteq> SEQ A;
   ?C1 \<noteq> {}\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> lexmin ?C1 ?i1
                    \<in> ith (eq_upto ?C1 (lexmin ?C1) ?i1) ?i1

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>C \<subseteq> SEQ A; C \<noteq> {}\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> lexmin C i \<in> ith (eq_upto C (lexmin C) i) i

lemma LEX_chain_on_eq_upto_imp_ith_chain_on:
  assumes "chain_on (LEX P) (eq_upto C f i) (SEQ A)"
  shows "chain_on P (ith (eq_upto C f i) i) A"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. chain_on P (ith (eq_upto C f i) i) A
using assms

proof (prove)
using this:
  chain_on (LEX P) (eq_upto C f i) (SEQ A)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. chain_on P (ith (eq_upto C f i) i) A
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. chain_on (LEX P) (eq_upto C f i) (SEQ A) \<Longrightarrow>
    chain_on P (ith (eq_upto C f i) i) A

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. chain_on (LEX P) (eq_upto C f i) (SEQ A) \<Longrightarrow>
    chain_on P (ith (eq_upto C f i) i) A
fix x y

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. chain_on (LEX P) (eq_upto C f i) (SEQ A) \<Longrightarrow>
    chain_on P (ith (eq_upto C f i) i) A

assume "x \<in> ith (eq_upto C f i) i" and "y \<in> ith (eq_upto C f i) i"
      and "\<not> P x y" and "y \<noteq> x"

proof (state)
this:
  x \<in> ith (eq_upto C f i) i
  y \<in> ith (eq_upto C f i) i
  \<not> P x y
  y \<noteq> x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. chain_on (LEX P) (eq_upto C f i) (SEQ A) \<Longrightarrow>
    chain_on P (ith (eq_upto C f i) i) A
then

proof (chain)
picking this:
  x \<in> ith (eq_upto C f i) i
  y \<in> ith (eq_upto C f i) i
  \<not> P x y
  y \<noteq> x

obtain g h where *: "g \<in> eq_upto C f i" "h \<in> eq_upto C f i"
      and [simp]: "x = g i" "y = h i" and eq: "\<forall>j<i. g j = f j \<and> h j = f j"

proof (prove)
using this:
  x \<in> ith (eq_upto C f i) i
  y \<in> ith (eq_upto C f i) i
  \<not> P x y
  y \<noteq> x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>g h.
        \<lbrakk>g \<in> eq_upto C f i; h \<in> eq_upto C f i; x = g i;
         y = h i; \<forall>j<i. g j = f j \<and> h j = f j\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
by (auto simp: ith_def eq_upto_def)

proof (state)
this:
  g \<in> eq_upto C f i
  h \<in> eq_upto C f i
  x = g i
  y = h i
  \<forall>j<i. g j = f j \<and> h j = f j

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. chain_on (LEX P) (eq_upto C f i) (SEQ A) \<Longrightarrow>
    chain_on P (ith (eq_upto C f i) i) A
with assms and \<open>y \<noteq> x\<close>

proof (chain)
picking this:
  chain_on (LEX P) (eq_upto C f i) (SEQ A)
  y \<noteq> x
  g \<in> eq_upto C f i
  h \<in> eq_upto C f i
  x = g i
  y = h i
  \<forall>j<i. g j = f j \<and> h j = f j
consider "LEX P g h" | "LEX P h g"

proof (prove)
using this:
  chain_on (LEX P) (eq_upto C f i) (SEQ A)
  y \<noteq> x
  g \<in> eq_upto C f i
  h \<in> eq_upto C f i
  x = g i
  y = h i
  \<forall>j<i. g j = f j \<and> h j = f j

 1. \<lbrakk>LEX P g h \<Longrightarrow> thesis;
     LEX P h g \<Longrightarrow> thesis\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> thesis
by (force simp: chain_on_def)

this:
